summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorney Brendan Quigley regarding the scheduling and preparation for an interview with David Rodgers, a witness in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistics, document review, and a specific inquiry about a name in flight logs that matches a missing Florida teenager from 1997.

persons.name: Brendan Quigley
persons.context: Attorney representing David Rodgers, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule his client's interview and provide flight logs.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Client of Brendan Quigley, scheduled to be interviewed by the U.S. Attorney's office regarding flight records as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with Brendan Quigley to arrange the interview with David Rodgers and discuss evidence.

persons.name: Andrew Lankler
persons.context: Attorney at Baker Botts copied on the email correspondence regarding David Rodgers.

persons.name: Wendy
persons.context: Mentioned as a colleague who may need to contact David Rodgers directly to arrange travel logistics.

connections.description: Quigley is the legal representative for David Rodgers, arranging his interview with prosecutors and providing his flight logs.
Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding to schedule a witness interview and discuss evidence in the Epstein investigation.
Both are attorneys at Baker Botts law firm working on the David Rodgers case.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with David Rodgers
events.description: Planned meeting at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza in New York between David Rodgers and the U.S. Attorney's office for an interview regarding flight records and the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Flight Log Entry Matching Missing Teenager
events.description: A flight log from August 1, 1997, shows a passenger name similar to a missing Florida teenager, prompting prosecutors to ask David Rodgers about it.

events.title: Production of Additional Flight Logs
events.description: Brendan Quigley sends additional flight logs for David Rodgers covering 1991 to January 2006 to the U.S. Attorney's office.

events.title: Initial Production of Flight Logs
events.description: Brendan Quigley provides initial flight logs for David Rodgers covering January 2006 to September 2013 to prosecutors.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors planned to question David Rodgers about a flight log entry from August 1, 1997, that contained a name similar to a missing Florida teenager.
David Rodgers was treated as a witness, not a target, with the interview focused on his flight records.
The email chain reveals ongoing cooperation and evidence production from the defense to the prosecution regarding flight logs from 1991 to 2013.
The correspondence highlights the logistical planning and confidentiality concerns surrounding a witness interview in the Epstein investigation.
